text: This sounds perfect for a workflow that checks that value of that dropdown and send an email notification based on  what the value is

Is the goal to just show what the page looks like or how it functions? Or does the blog post need to have a page embedded so the reader can interact with it?

For the first option I would do a screen recording and embed a video.
For second option I would use screenshots that when clicked open the page in a new window.
Anyone have trouble FTP’ing into <http://Hubapi.com|Hubapi.com> today/lately?  I keep getting Authentication Failed but I’ve checked my login/password. Also tried my other HS accounts to no avail.

Looks like every time I try to log in to FTP, I get a “Your HubSpot Login Code” verification email.  I verified by logging in through the browser, but if I try FTP again it still won’t let me login and it sends me another verification email.
do you have 2FA enabled on the portal? You can not use 2FA with FTP currently
No, 2FA is not enabled
it just has to be enabled in A portal using your user name. Not THE portal you wan to work in.

I’m thinking of having a short form (say, a form field for email), and once that form is submitted, have a longer form popup in a modal with the email field pre-filled. Is this somehow possible out of the box or should I use the Forms API?

You could probably do something with an `onFormSubmit` callback.  This fires before the data is actually submitted, so you would have to write a script to get the email field value from the original form and populate it in the pop up form.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/advanced_form_options>

I am building a blog listing page for one of my clients here: <https://blog.davincilabs.com/dev-blog> and for some reason the twitter button is a few pixels higher than all the other buttons. Does anyone have a css snippet to help align these buttons?
thanks <@UB690RZA7>

worked really well - thanks

So we have a client who has contacts with their domain email (same domain in HubSpot just not setup as a user) and their personal email. Since merging these contacts the client is noticing the contacts are split into two again. Anyone have any idea why or how this could happen?
Hmm, no I have no 2FA enabled for any of my HS accounts on any portals that I know of.  But I’ll keep digging!
